newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia says foreign investment approvals down.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia says foreign investment approvals down.

text.p: Indonesian approval of foreign investments between January and mid-December this year fell to $29.9 billion from $39.9 billion for the whole of 1995, Investment Minister Sanyoto Sastrowardoyo said on Wednesday.

"There has indeed been a drop in foreign investment approvals this year," he told reporters after meeting President Suharto. "There were several mega-projects approved last year, but this year such projects were not many."
He said, however, 959 projects were approved between January and mid-December this year, compared with 799 projects during the whole of 1995.
"The projects included the chemical, agricultural and property sectors," he said.
